bibl.title: Territory of Washington v. Walker et al. Summary of Case
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

org.orgName: United States District Court For The Western District of Washington Northern Division

div1.p: Grace Stunter: file sworn: am the mile of M Stuner was reciting Mr Walker last evening: Mr. Lockwood was then: have known him since last February: Left Mrs Walkers I think about one o'clock this morning according to Mr Hunter watch Mr. Lockwood my sister miss Arnold: Mr & Mrs Dolan my husband any myself left together: we live on E. St between 19th & 21st and we came home by R.R. track & depot: went straight home & upon reaching there left Mr Lockwood: that is the last we saw of him, and think it was sometime between one & half past: had some beer at Mrs Walkers did not act as though under the influence of house at all when was with us: was alone when he left us__ Have met Mrs Walker but once was the first time I had been at her house would take about 25 minutes to go from an house to Mrs Walkers: didn't see anyone when oing home: had but one lantern in our party:

Emma Arnold: sworn: M L saw me home last night from Mrs Walkers: must have ben a quarter to one when we left there: Mr Lockwood left me at my sister Mrs Stunters: he said nothing to me about returning to Mrs Walkers: he drank 3.04 glasses of beer at Mr Walkers: I not do not think he was intoxicated at all:
Wm E. Hunter: a Painter: sworn: corrolerated wifes & Miss Arnold's evidence:
Tho. Sty. Dolan: Corrolerates Mr & Mrs Hunter K. Miss Arnold's testimony__ never saw Lockwood more sober:
